channel.title: Error Connecting to Server
channel.description:
Hey there everybody, I took a long break from RSPS and came back to try again. I recently downloaded a cleaned out 317 Allstar source and I'm having trouble with connecting. I've portforwarded what I believe is correctly, but I can only connect to my server through localhost. When I try to enter my server's no-ip given name I get a message saying "Error Connecting to Server". I'm not sure if that message is what everybody sees, or if only I see it. I tried canyouseeme.org which told me it cannot see the service on port 43594.
If somebody could help me out it would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.

item.title: Error Connecting to Server
item.dc:creator: @Korkle Korkle
item.description:
@Korkle wrote:

No that’s not it at all haha, I’m just suprised.

Read full topic

Lol dont you believe me? It sounds like you dont… Btw. Im currently online via my mobile phone

only players can connect through no-ip

item.title: Error Connecting to Server
item.dc:creator: @06Rs 06Rs
item.description:
@06Rs wrote:

Hey Korkle,

looks like you didn’t connect your server with your router right, try portforward.com i use that and they help me portforward my runescape private server, everyday. They check your router, they connect, they run it, no virus, free, and it is very sufficient. Or just you 127.0.0.1 or retry your method if you don’t believe the website.

Read full topic

item.title: Error Connecting to Server
item.dc:creator: @Korkle Korkle
item.description:
@Korkle wrote:

Hey there everybody, I took a long break from RSPS and came back to try again.
I recently downloaded a cleaned out 317 Allstar source and I’m having trouble with connecting.
I’ve portforwarded what I believe is correctly, but I can only connect to my server through localhost.
When I try to enter my server’s no-ip given name I get a message saying “Error Connecting to Server”.
I’m not sure if that message is what everybody sees, or if only I see it. I tried canyouseeme.org which told me it cannot see the service on port 43594.

If somebody could help me out it would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.
